creditline: Bequest of Dr. John I. Coe
provenance: [Milch Gallery, New York, sold to Coe, 1959]; John I. Coe, Edina, Minn., 1959-d.2011; Estate of John I. Coe, New Brighton, Minn.; bequethed to MIA, 2011.
signed: at left edge, above center, in black: Childe Hassam / 1910
text: In 1910, Hassam and his wife Kathleen Doan traveled to Paris. This scene could have been set in one of the urban gardens there – or in his home city of New York City. He loathed the way that rapid urban development blotted out the green space around his Manhattan studio. In some works, he edited out or minimized the skyscrapers at the edge of city parks. Made after he committed himself to wellness following a period of depression and heavy drinking, the scene may express the renewed feeling he had for life and the outdoors.
title: In the Park
